p: In addition, this youthful age group is vital for reproduction, knowledge accumulation and transfer, as well as economic productivity. As the experience of HIV and AIDS and EVD illustrates, losing this cohort has a significant negative impact upon agricultural productivity and knowledge retention and transfer, and productivity in that sector and beyond, as well as with regard to political (in)stability. Should there ever be an epidemic/pandemic of H5N1, the loss of this age cohort in particular would have far-reaching social, economic and political consequences.
